momo 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference
    • Fine-scale movement modeling based on tagging data
    • Releases
    • Version 0.0.0.9000
    • Changelog

momo is a new R package for tagging-based movement modeling, specifically designed to estimate fine-scale animal movement patterns using various tagging data, such as mark-recapture, mark-resight, and data-logging/archival tags. The movement model is based on the advection-diffusion equation and incorporates habitat preference functions, enabling the reconstruction of individual movement paths and inference of population-level movement dynamics using a small set of interpretable parameters. Movement rates are estimated as a function of environmental conditions or geographic locations.

Installation 

# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("tokami/momo")
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("tokami/momo", ref = "dev")

Usage

Get started with:

Citation

Please use the R command citation("momo") to receive information on how to cite this package.

Documentation

The tutorial vignette demonstrates the use of the main functions of momo for estimating habitat suitability and movement patterns for simulated example data.

Questions / Issues

In case you have questions or find bugs, please write an email to Tobias Mildenberger or post on momo/issues.

References

  1. Mildenberger, T. K., Maunder, M., Nielsen, A. (in process). momo: an R package for the estimation of fine-scale animal movement based on tagging data link
  2. Mildenberger, T. K., et al. (in process). Habitat suitability and movement of Skipjack tuna in the Eastern Pacific Ocean link
